info.description: Waveforms in a CWB (Common Waveform Buffer) data repository can be accessed using this Java client. The client processes these data on your computer and produces files in MiniSEED, SAC or plain text formats.

conf.name: default
conf.description: runtime dependencies and master artifact can be used with this conf

conf.name: master
conf.description: contains only the artifact published by this module itself, with no transitive dependencies

conf.name: bin-dist
conf.description: contains a binary distribution of the master artifact and all dependencies

conf.name: compile
conf.description: this is the default scope, used if none is specified. Compile dependencies are available in all classpaths.

conf.name: provided
conf.description: this is much like compile, but indicates you expect the JDK or a container to provide it. It is only available on the compilation classpath, and is not transitive.

conf.name: runtime
conf.description: this scope indicates that the dependency is not required for compilation, but is for execution. It is in the runtime and test classpaths, but not the compile classpath.

conf.name: test
conf.description: this scope indicates that the dependency is not required for normal use of the application, and is only available for the test compilation and execution phases.

conf.name: system
conf.description: this scope is similar to provided except that you have to provide the JAR which contains it explicitly. The artifact is always available and is not looked up in a repository.

conf.name: sources
conf.description: this configuration contains the source artifact of this module, if any.

conf.name: javadoc
conf.description: this configuration contains the javadoc artifact of this module, if any.

conf.name: foride
conf.description: this configuration contains the source and/or javadoc artifacts of this modules dependecies for use to provide documentation in IDE.
